context_bundle.summary: Loki is a horizontally-scalable, highly-available log aggregation system inspired by Prometheus and designed for Kubernetes

onboarding.quick_start: helm install loki grafana/loki-stack --namespace loki --set loki.persistence.enabled=true --set promtail.enabled=true && kubectl get svc -n loki loki
common_patterns: Loki deployment: 'helm install loki grafana/loki --set persistence.enabled=true'
Promtail configuration: 'config snippets' with 'scrape_configs' for log file paths and labels
LogQL queries: '{job="kubelet"} |= "error"' for log search and filtering
Grafana integration: Add Loki datasource with URL 'http://loki:3100'
known_errors: No logs received: 'kubectl logs -n loki promtail-*' and check file paths and scrape configuration
High disk usage: 'kubectl exec -n loki loki-0 -- df -h' and implement retention policies
Query timeout: 'curl -G -s http://loki:3100/loki/api/v1/query_range --data-urlencode query="{job='varlogs'}"' and optimize LogQL
Grafana connection failed: 'curl http://loki:3100/ready' and verify datasource configuration
